bibl.title: On the Provenance of the Four Christian Inscriptions: SB X 10515-10516, M.G. Tibiletti Bruno, Iscrizioni Nubiane 49, 56.
bibl.note: Four inscriptions originating from the cemetery at Ginari-Tafa in Lower Nubia. -1-2. S.B. X, 10515; 10516 [republished by G.J.M.J. TE RIELE in: P.J. SIJPESTEIJN and K.A. WORP, Greek Texts in the Possession of the Amsterdam University Library, Talanta 8-9 (1977) p. 116]. These inscriptions are not forgeries. - 3-4. Maria Grazia TIBILETTI BRUNO, Iscrizioni Nubiane (Pavia, 1964) Nos 49; 56. These inscriptions were not unpublished; cf. C.M. FIRTH, The Archaeological Survey of Nubia. Report for 1908-1909, I (Cairo, 1912) pp. 49 (Grave 807); 46 (Grave 230).
bibl.seg: LAJTAR Adam, On the Provenance of the Four Christian Inscriptions: SB X 10515-10516, M.G. Tibiletti Bruno, Iscrizioni Nubiane 49, 56.

WORP, Greek Texts in the Possession of the Amsterdam University Library, Talanta 8-9 (1977) p. 116]. These inscriptions are not forgeries. - 3-4. Maria Grazia TIBILETTI BRUNO, Iscrizioni Nubiane (Pavia, 1964) Nos 49; 56. These inscriptions were not unpublished; cf. C.M. FIRTH, The Archaeological Survey of Nubia. Report for 1908-1909, I (Cairo, 1912) pp. 49 (Grave 807); 46 (Grave 230).
